metadata.title: CVE-2019-19624 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read was discovered in OpenCV before 4.1.1. Specifically,variable coarsest_scale is assumed to be greater than or equal tofinest_scale within the calc()/ocl_calc() functions in dis_flow.cpp.However, this is not true when dealing with small images, leading to anout-of-bounds read of the heap-allocated arrays Ux and Uy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19624` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-contrib4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-core4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-dnn4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-features2d4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-flann4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-highgui4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgcodecs4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgproc4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-ml4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-objdetect4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-photo4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-shape4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-stitching4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-superres4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-video4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-videoio4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-videostab4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-viz4.5 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv4.5-java - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv4.5-jni - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
opencv-data - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
python3-opencv - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: opencv package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.2+dfsg-5').
